If it's your first time playing a bioshock game you're most likely gonna love it. But for me the gameplay was changed in a bad way. 

The original and the sequel had more closed off rooms, it felt a bit claustrophobic. Here you have sky hooks and big open levels. The places where the shooting happenes is bigger but their setting is not that interesting. Also having only 2 weapons at a time is seriously annoying because the ammo cap for weapons is too small. 

I didn't really like the story either. A lot of the time when a story involves [spoiler] time travel its used badly. Like time travel is only used sort of as a weak deus ex machina. When i got to the ending i had a feeling that it shouldn't work like it did. Seemed to me like it was a big paradox of sorts. And it didn't even have to end like that. Imagine if they traveled in time before wounded knee and just stopped booker from going to wounded knee. He wouldn't have become comstock. [/spoiler]

As for the dlc, i thought episode 1 was kinda boring. But episode 2 was pretty cool, the stealth was really basic. But it was filled with story and i was more invested than i was in the main plot.  [spoiler] But the ending was like seeing a cripled begar in the street, kinda sad but not something note worthy. The ending combined columbia and rapture. It felt really cool, and a bit cheap at the same time. As i said i didnt really like infinite, and this felt like it was trying to piggy back off of better charachters that were in the original bioshock. [/spoiler]

Overall 5/10 not a bad game, but kinda overhyped.

[spoiler] Imagine being able to control time and hop to alternate dimensions, but you still decide to kill your only friend.  [/spoiler]
